original_data.question: A 3-year-old male was brought to the pediatrician with severe lip lacerations, with a portion of his tongue appearing to be bitten off, as well as missing portions of the fingers on his right hand. A family history is notable for two similar cases in male cousins on the mother's side. A urinalysis revealed a high level of uric acid. Which of the following is the mode of inheritance for this disorder?

model_response:
The mode of inheritance for this disorder is X-linked recessive. The affected male has a defective hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), which is responsible for the salvage of purines. This results in the accumulation of purines, which are then metabolized to uric acid. X-linked recessive inheritance is characterized by the following: Males are more frequently affected than females. The carrier female is usually asymptomatic. The affected male does not transmit the disorder to his sons, but all daughters are carriers.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
A medical doctor with specialized training in the care of children.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.
One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.

A muscular organ in the mouth that is covered with pink tissue called mucosa, tiny bumps called papillae, and thousands of taste buds. The tongue is anchored to the mouth and is vital for chewing, swallowing, and for speech.
One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.
Four or five slender jointed digits in humans and primates, attached to each HAND.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.
A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
A child of your aunt or uncle or their descendents.
Milk that is produced by HUMAN MAMMARY GLANDS.
A line segment forming part of the perimeter of a plane figure.

Examination of urine by chemical, physical, or microscopic means. Routine urinalysis usually includes performing chemical screening tests, determining specific gravity, observing any unusual color or odor, screening for bacteriuria, and examining the sediment microscopically.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

An oxidation product, via XANTHINE OXIDASE, of oxypurines such as XANTHINE and HYPOXANTHINE. It is the final oxidation product of purine catabolism in humans and primates, whereas in most other mammals URATE OXIDASE further oxidizes it to ALLANTOIN.
A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.
